create procedure dbo.USR_USP_DATAFORMTEMPLATE_ADD_MERGECOMMITMENTS ( @ID uniqueidentifier = null output, @CONTEXTID nvarchar(100), @CHANGEAGENTID uniqueidentifier = null, @MERGECOMMITMENTS xml = null, @EARLIESTSTARTDATE datetime = null, @DELETERECORDS bit = 0 ) as
set nocount on;
if @ID is null set @ID = newid()
if @CHANGEAGENTID is null exec dbo.USP_CHANGEAGENT_GETORCREATECHANGEAGENT @CHANGEAGENTID output
declare @CURRENTDATE datetime set @CURRENTDATE = getdate()
begin try -- handle inserting the data
declare @MERGESET table(ID nvarchar(100)) insert into @MERGESET select T.mergecommitments.value('(COMMITMENTID)[1]','nvarchar(100)') from @MERGECOMMITMENTS.nodes('/MERGECOMMITMENTS/ITEM') T(mergecommitments)
declare @COMMITMENTID uniqueidentifier set @COMMITMENTID = (select ID from SPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENT where LOOKUPID = @CONTEXTID)
--CHANGE ALL THE SPONSORSHIPIDS FROM THE MERGE COMMITMENTS TO THE TARGET (CONTEXT) COMMITMENT update SPONSORSHIP set SPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENTID = @COMMITMENTID, ISMOSTRECENTFORCOMMITMENT = 0 where SPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENTID in (select SC.ID from @MERGESET M inner join SPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENT SC on M.ID = SC.LOOKUPID)
--NOW THAT ALL THE COMMITMENTS ARE MERGED...MERGE ALL THE RECURRING GIFTS TOGETHER declare @SPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENTSELECTIONID uniqueidentifier declare @LOOKUPID nvarchar(100) declare @NUMBEREDITED int declare @NUMBERDELETED int set @LOOKUPID = @CONTEXTID
exec USR_USP_MERGESPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENTRECURRINGGIFTS @SPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENTSELECTIONID, @LOOKUPID, @EARLIESTSTARTDATE, @DELETERECORDS, @NUMBEREDITED, @NUMBERDELETED, @CHANGEAGENTID
end try
begin catch exec dbo.USP_RAISE_ERROR return 1 end catch
return 0
